intro: Oeonia aubertii, commonly known as the Aubert's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are small and clustered, with a distinctive cyathium structure that houses the reproductive organs. Oeonia aubertii is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in challenging environmental conditions.
